Detailed Description

Utilities for PS3 Framebuffer.

Function Documentation

int ctk_ps3fb_advance_current_frame (  ) 

Displays (sets) the current frame (returned by ctk_ps3fb_ get_current_frame()) and advances the current frame number. (This internally calls ctk_ps3fb_flip().)

Returns:
0 (CTK_SUCCESS) on success, errno on failure.

int ctk_ps3fb_clear (  ) 

Clears the frame buffer.

Returns:
0 (CTK_SUCCESS) on success, errno on failure.

void ctk_ps3fb_close (  ) 

Closes the PS3 Framebuffer device. (Normally this would be called automatically when the program exit)

int ctk_ps3fb_flip ( unsigned int  frame  ) 

Transfers the frame buffer in the user space and flips the frame.

Returns:
0 (CTK_SUCCESS) on success, errno on failure.

int ctk_ps3fb_get (  ) 

Takes the control of FB by stopping the ps3fbd flipping.

Returns:
0 (CTK_SUCCESS) on success, errno on failure.

void* ctk_ps3fb_get_current_frame (  ) 

Returns the FB memory region for the current frame. (This internally calls ctk_ps3fb_wait_vsync() and ctk_ps3fb_get_frame().)

Returns:
non-null addr on success, NULL on failure.

void* ctk_ps3fb_get_frame ( unsigned int  frame  ) 

Returns the FB memory region for the frame buffer specified by the given frame.

Returns:
non-null addr on success, NULL on failure.

int ctk_ps3fb_get_frame_count (  ) 

Returns the # of available frame count.

Returns:
the number of frames (>0) on success, -errno (<0) on failure.

int ctk_ps3fb_get_screen_info ( ctk_ps3screen_t *  screen  ) 

Returns the screen information.

Returns:
0 (CTK_SUCCESS) on success, errno on failure.

int ctk_ps3fb_get_screen_size ( unsigned int *  xres,
unsigned int *  yres,
unsigned int *  xoff,
unsigned int *  yoff 
)

Returns the screen size.

Returns:
0 (CTK_SUCCESS) on success, errno on failure.

int ctk_ps3fb_open (  ) 

Opens and initializes the PS3 Framebuffer device. This also gets the controll of FB by stopping the flipping in the kernel (i.e. by calling ctk_ps3fb_get()). This must be called in prior to calling any other PS3FB routines. Typical call sequence would look like this: 

  ctk_ps3fb_open();

  ctk_ps3screen_t screen;
  ctk_ps3fb_get_screen_info(&screen);
  // set initial parameters by using screen sizes

  while (1) {
      // gets the current buffer frame
      void *fb_buf = ctk_ps3fb_get_current_frame();

      // fill the fb_buf memory region

      // displays the filled buffer and advances the frame
      ctk_ps3fb_advance_current_frame();
  }

  ctk_ps3fb_close();
Returns:
0 (CTK_SUCCESS) on success, errno on failure.

int ctk_ps3fb_release (  ) 

Releases the FB control by re-starting the ps3fbd flipping.

Returns:
0 (CTK_SUCCESS) on success, errno on failure.

int ctk_ps3fb_wait_vsync (  ) 

Waits the next VSync.

Returns:
0 (CTK_SUCCESS) on success, errno on failure.
